note.p: Death: Kimmage Lodge, County Dublin, Ireland (05 November 1857)

Career: Went to London (1804); Laboratory Operator and Assistant, Royal Institution, through the influence of Humphry Davy; had control of the laboratory (1804-1813); Professor, Royal Cork Institution (1813); Professor of Chemistry, Royal Dublin Society (1826); wrote on agricultural chemistry, electro-chemistry and metallurgy
Notes: Citation: first 'being' deliberately obscured & '[...] ... being' inserted; small sections of certificate missing
